meanings.definition: To purchase more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outbuy her friends when they go shopping together.
meanings.sent2: I managed to outbuy my siblings at the candy store.
meanings.sent3: The competition to outbuy each other at the auction was fierce.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outbuy the other bidders was evident in his focused expression.
meanings.sent5: In the game, the goal is to outbuy your opponents and become the ultimate shopper.

meanings.definition: To buy something at a lower price than someone else.
meanings.sent1: I was able to outbuy the other customers by finding a great discount.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outbuy her friends by shopping during sales.
meanings.sent3: Trying to outbuy the store owner himself, she haggled for a better deal.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outbuy everyone else in the market made him a savvy shopper.
meanings.sent5: The challenge is to outbuy the competition and get the best deal possible.
